q2Yg9dffNQsTW_kJW8dmqg.text: Love this place. Usually great food (although some dishes can be a bit off). Service is typically great and the ambiance is some of the best in charlotte.

PbYJ9a5H4EFvTBJYkpnf9Q.text: Just had an awesome experience at Angeline's.  Our experience started with a fantastic host, Aiesha, who greeted us as if we were family.  She was pleasant, kind and professional.  Next, our waiter, Tyler, was awesome. He took great care of us, ensuring that our every need was met.  His patience was really appreciated as there were so many fantastic options on the menu that we had trouble deciding.  Adrienne, the manager, stopped by to make sure that everything was going well and helped us to decide.  The food, and we ordered a lot of it, was amazing.  There's everything to love here.  We will definitely be coming back!

aSWBguHHDw4HutXyB8DF8g.text: Gonna have to go ahead and underscore what others are saying about the salad. Tiny portion ($12 lunch salad I believe it was before any protein). Measly boring couple of salad leaves and not much else. Worse, the chicken breast I did get was puny, like a young child's portion tiny. My colleague's ordered the same thing but got obviously more chicken, like almost double (still, like a 10 year old's portion). Also the lunch menu is limited unless you like carbs a lot (pasta, pizza, sandwiches). Barely a few salads with no listed protein (had to ask for chicken).  Service was not great either. Waiter acted like my work colleague was out of line asking for bread at lunch. Won't be coming back. Cool decor though.

2RrKJVNBn1T0V8DO6KewiQ.text: First time visit.    We made reservations and arrived 10 mins ahead.  We were escorted to a crowded small area of two top tables.  We requested a booth but we're told none were available....yet 3 were open and set.  We asked if specific tables were reserved at this establishment and the answer was of course no.  Reluctantly, we sat at the table just feet away from the kitchen.  Some 45 mins nearing the end of our meal we noticed that the third of of the 3rd of the open booths was being sat.  We again asked about this and the waiter could not or would not respond.  The only difference we could see.....we are an interracial couple...the booths were all occupied by white couples.  Now to the food.  Great tasting.  That said, being sat near the kitchen does have it advantages or disadvantages if you are someone that might be bothered by unsanitary behavior by the prepping and serving staff.  Not once but 3 times the lead food runner put his clearly unclean hands on the food he was about to serve.  The last time he had dropped his writing pen on the floor only to pick it up then reach over and pick up a bun and place on the plate and then he promptly served it to an unaware guest.  Make your own call on this one.

I721kukV7nWKzEF2OI_mgA.text: Outstanding food and ambiance. Higher end Italian restaurant. Met an old friend for dinner and service was great and the chef even visited the table to make sure we enjoyed our meal.

k7BhJAj3GKIM45A-PhZYHQ.text: I received great service from the bar by Maddie and Marshall...they provided professional service, pleasant conversation, and amazing cocktails. The polpette mash potato pizza is my FAV, I cant help but get it every time. Sit at the bar, you will not be disappointed.

ZVwKBwaT9KMMlzhJXDMz-w.text: Ayesha is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! I would go here every single day just to see her smiling face! Great service!

OxFxTBp4TKOdHU_7pKNZRg.text: Awesome restaurant, the food and atmosphere were very good. Aiesha the host of the restaurant was very welcoming. I'd come back just to say HI to her! Joe is very nice and knowledgable about his wine along with the great management Adrienne took very good care of us. Tyler was our waiter and made sure we were well taken care of us. We'll be back next time revisit Charlotte.

C3l2jM8H_fwvLfug5WpuTw.text: Just had our Xmas meal at Angeline's. Everything was FABULOUS. Sam & Kevin took great care of us. Sam was very attentive. Kevin took time to beautifully explain our meal to us. The bread came with a olive spread that started us out on a great high note. We had Fried Brussels Sprouts as an appetizer. I know many don't like Brussels Sprouts but we do and these had a super tasty balsamic vinegar dressing on it. Hubby had 1/2 chicken, I had the pappardelle bolognese, both dishes were some of the finest we've ever had. We finished with the Chocolate Ganache cake. Our bellies were very  satisfied as we waddled out of there.

6GcwGJL8fmywiQz9x6iM6A.text: Kelli Brennan ! Wow this place made my day! First time in Charlotte! Best place ever! Amazing drinks and food! Kelly is the sweetest!  The Power of Love! Drink is soooo good! Must visittttttt!!!!!

0kvSZUCI3pkNBMCWfOKidg.text: Went to dinner here last Friday night with my uncle and his wife for her birthday. The food was not what I expected the chef could of put a lot of more effort into the dish. The flavors were not authentic I was a little disappointed, but my aunt enjoyed the birthday card and dessert.

RhXgbzbHYKKQRLm__Xl4YQ.text: We love Angeline's! Always good service and great food. They take reservations and even if you don't have one, we've never waited long for a table. Never had a bad meal!

OYbobNQFLY0lGUbarkvsYQ.text: Two stars because the food was very good. Unfortunately, we'll never return because of the service. After 30 minutes waiting for our checks (after overhearing our server say he was going to be in 'Check hell' for splitting 5 checks), another server came over and gave us one check and said their system didn't allow them to split checks. Our first server couldn't have told us that in the first 5 minutes of trying? Plenty of other great food in Charlotte (pasta at Customshop and Flourshop), no need to return with service like that. Beware if you're a group trying to pay with more than one card!

NcO_ukJZmp7K8g0VNKmnjw.text: I am a big time foodie who also loves to cook. I have been waiting to dine at Angeline's until the time was right. I was attending a show last night so I thought it was the perfect opportunity to try it. There were 4 of us and we decided to order several items to share for the table. First we had the whipped ricotta and crispy bread. It was delicious. Next, we had the calamari. Not only was it soggy, but there were lots of broken pieces and some random pieces of fried vegetables. Very small amount of calamari and it had no flavor. Next came the pizza which was good. Finally, we had a pasta dish made with ribbon noodles in some sort of a "brownish" sauce. This was the biggest disappointment! The pasta was soggy and over cooked and for 20 something dollars, it was barely an appetizer sized potion. At that point, we decided to get dessert elsewhere. With all the restaurant choices, this place really needs to "step it up"

sTFCxINMGl8PX-KyVDJjmw.text: Atmosphere is great.  Service wonderful.  Food average.  Portions ridiculously small for the $$$$  Recommendation to owner: rebrand as Italian tapas, lower price some of each dish and TELL ME I need to order 3 dishes for a complete meal.

9RCyYZDdFOgK-KypvpyBYg.text: I visited Angeline's on Friday night with my family. The decor is impressive, and the food did not disappoint. My favorite was the Melanzane Alla Parmigiana (eggplant, fresh mozzarella, pomodoro, crispy black kale). I will definitely be back!

2Rj02DWdmDVjCsGcs9fZ2A.text: We went to this place Saturday night on girls night. The food was amazing. The atmosphere was so nice.  The service was exceptional. We will go back.

8rOvCijebAB-FIqXrokfhA.text: I was hesitant to choose this restaurant because of the other negative reviews that showed poor service with larger groups, and I should have listened. We had the worst service any of us had every experienced at a decently nice restaurant. Our waitress was rude, had no interest in responding to questions and snapped at anyone asking a question. Furthermore, she was unhelpful when we needed something. Everyone else was great, but her attitude put a damper on the evening.  Hopefully they work out these service issues because the food was decent and the rest of the staff was friendly.

nhfZ_g0tP_9padip9PJ4Tw.text: While the food was good, it was nothing to write home about. However my biggest compliant was a pricing issue. The waiter suggested I add scallops to my pasta. Upon receiving my check I found out that adding 3 scallops cost $24, making my pasta more than any other entree on the menu. I called to see if there was an error since $42 (pats plus scallops) was more than the seafood entrees that include scallops as well as other seafood. She said the only error was that my waiter was supposed to tell me. It was definitely not a $42 dinner.

D9pqwVUkTT07h5grXzsc6w.text: If you like your salt with some food on the side, then this is the place to go... had the clams and pasta, so salty I ended pouring my glass of water in it and added some lemon slices to it.  It made it better but I was not hungry by then.  My friend had some kind of chicken pasta,  same thing, just got very heavy handed with the salt. My other friend got the burger but she said it was just ok, not too impressed. Be prepared for fresh cut anchovies on your Caesar salads,  Enjoy!

svVvCpXa_iwGn-qJVEsREQ.text: I went to Angeline's with my girlfriend on Saturday night. We sat at the bar because it was so busy so I didn't have a complete dining experience. Our bartender was very friendly and helpful in recommending dishes. The ambience and decor inside was very cool. I thought the food was good. I wouldn't say it was amazing but definitely good. For the price I was hoping for better food, but I'd probably go back again. We ordered the calamari and the cioppino to start. Both were good but preferred the cioppino. Next we had the oxtail pasta and the scallops. They past was good but the scallops were by far our favorite dish. They also have a decent wine and drink menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States

2gvCEgWr5TdTBvoq9dJKNQ.text: We took our friend here for a birthday dinner and they treated her like absolute royalty.  Our server was personal and informative. The sommelier was extremely helpful in aiding us along in our wine selection. The olive tapenade that came with our bread was the best we've ever had and the rest of our meal didn't disappoint. We will be back!

FwOQ-4O6kJCNzCuFCJOmEg.text: Went to Angeline's for a birthday dinner last night. Staff was very attentive and friendly. Really enjoyed the food and atmosphere, however my only complaint would be the food temperature. For an appetizer I had the fried calamari, for my entree I had the linguine with clams and for dessert, the chocolate cake (meh). Dishes were satisfying, just not as hot as I would anticipate. Definitely worth a second trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States

i5wZj6NuAGw93TMV0Edmog.text: We came here by pure coincidence and we had such a great experience!!! Our server was Justin and he did such an amazing job!!! Our food was amazing as well as the service!!! Best firewood oven pizzas in town!!!

ems6xRehqKnDFvKmG0tpzg.text: Sit down and let us tell you a story about the best lil' bowl of Bolognese in uptown.  Angeline's is now open for lunch and they have some really good options but the pappardelle with bolognese and crispy guanciale is the best thing on the menu.  Close second is the whipped Ricotta appetizer.  The inside space is beautiful and we can't wait to try out the patio when it gets warmer.  Definitely a good spot for a business lunch in uptown!

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pappardelle with Bolognese + Crispy Guanciale
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pappardelle with Bolognese + Crispy Guanciale
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Whipped Ricotta with Sourdough, Lavender Honey + Pistachios

8EUn-7gIspjCZiwu8OHoHg.text: This review is for Friends and Family Brunch Weekend 1/28/18.  I had the opportunity to try out their newly developed brunch menu. After brunch we provided feedback for quality of food and service. I would go back to try the carbonara and would love to try the craft cocktails.  The brunch menu is lengthy. It was hard to decide. For my brunch visit, I had the following dishes:  Avocado Toast-Avocado Toast Avocado Mousse, Ciabatta, Fried Prosciutto, Calabrian Aioli- ciabatta, sturdy enough to hold the mousse. avocado mousse, smooth as a mousse should be but I'd prefer a bit more texture in this case. I'm the first to preach about the importance of lime juice or lemon juice to cut the fat of an avocado but in this case, there was a bit too much. fried prosciutto was crispy, a welcomed contrast to the smooth texture of the mousse and aioli. calabrian  ( pepper) aioli- mild, more mayonnaise flavor. My wish was for my spice in the aioli.   Banana Bread French Toast Whipped Sorghum Butter, Compressed Strawberries, Candied Pecans-I wanted more flavor. I will compare the taste to a banana muffin. I longed for crispy edges that I love  from a perfectly cooked piece of French toast.   House Selections of Salumi & Cheeses, House Giardiniera, Fig Jam, Breads- the cheese selection varies by chef's choice. The jam was delicious!  Whipped Ricotta  Sourdough, Lavender Honey, Pistachio-one of my faves. An impressive balance of flavor. The lavender wasn't as present as I would've liked.  *Hash16 Braised Oxtail, Caramelized Onions, Bell Peppers, Taleggio Fonduta, Rosemary Potatoes, Sunny Up Eggs-another fave. I shared this dish with one of my tablemates. The kitchen staff kindly separated the dish into two bowls for us. More oxtail, less potatoes. The egg was cooked nicely.  Chocolate Cake 9 Smoked Sea Salt Ganache, Fernet Cherry-I love chocolate! On a different day, I may have eaten more of this dessert but today, it was too rich for me. The cherry served as a garnish and didn't add anything to the dish. This is a shareable dessert.

CkWRNJB4B-0ZbI4SCWz7Aw.text: OBJECT IN FOOD!! DON'T ORDER THE BURGERS!! I wish I could give this place ZERO stars. We ordered the KIDS burger and THIS was inside of it! For size reference, it's the size of a quarter and as thick an almond. The female manager seemed less than concerned and said, "Oh, we'll take the burger off your bill." Of course you will because I would not have paid for it. Fortunately, I was eating the burger and not one of my children who could have DIED if it had became logged in their throat. A health inspection needs to be done to see what is going on in their meat grinding process. It is NOT up to code.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States

PI-xCIoSmvODpHwzPdYDXA.text: I came in by myself for Christmas dinner. Katy was my server. She was fantastic and made wonderful suggestions. I had mussels to start, followed by the caprese salad. I had the red snapper for my main course. All were excellent! Will definitely be back.

J71F5VAvsOVjKABymeCExw.text: Angeline's is beautiful, has a wonderful atmosphere and delicious appetizers and entrees. But the most standout thing about this restaurant was our server, Katelynn. She was so kind and helpful, and was very nice to me and really elevated the experience. I have never experienced a kinder, more generous waitress and I hope that you are graced with her opportunity when you dine at Angeline's.

OPQo4Oeka6g-uRYYLjHOJA.text: Yum! Angeline's is on point for service standards and food quality! Always so helpful to make us happy last minute by finding a table or making us wait comfortably at the bar. Id like to see their drink menu change a little but the bubble with fruit is good so I can't really complain. I just like more options.

Rxgau6XN2Bg4R96eerHF4g.text: After researching several Italian restaurants in Charlotte I decided on Angeline's.  The menu online listed Chicken Parmesan and Cioppino as menu items.  When we got to the restaurant neither of these items were on the menu-we were told by the waiter that "sorry we really need to update the menu online".  The chicken parmesan dish has been replaced by another chicken dish-which unfortunately we decided to give a try.  It was TERRIBLE.  The chicken was so dry none of us on the table could finish it-it had absolutely NO flavor either.  This dinner was a birthday dinner for two of the 4 in the party-what a disappointment!  WE will never be back.   This is the first time I have posted a review on YELP-but I was so disappointed by our experience I do not want others to have the Birthday dinner fail we did.

O34VMPs-dTkW3Vl6yj_Rng.text: Very good! I work uptown so my wife and I decided to go here for our 2nd anniversary (awwwwwwww) it was awesome! The staff was prompt and very friendly, also knowledgeable about the menu and made outstanding recommendations. Literally everyone we encountered wished us a happy anniversary, I've been to more places than I can count all over the US and world and no one has treated us better for this special event. So kudos to them! The food was very good. If you're looking for an upscale Italian restaurant in the Charlotte area, I'd recommend this place.

cxt8I7JIuytAvim3J_T_3g.text: The food was good and could have been greAt. The caprese salad had the best tomatoes ever, nice  amount of basil, but they gave the chinciest portion of fresh mozzarella!  Those having the chopped salad could not find the cheese in it.  For desert I got the peach cobbler with a scoop of gelato.  The peach cobbler was very good, but they gave me mini scoop of gelato.  Why cheap out just give a normal amount.  Could have been much better with a manager using some common sense.

eg-I0MzkQY8jrc3pQpcttA.text: Not worth the price. Service was just ok. Food was not that good. We had doughy, undercooked pizzas, seafood pasta was underwhelming for price, salads were dry, overall experience is not great food that is overpriced. Beautiful interior, but definitely disappointed in the overall experience. :(

MIzvrRLAHVLcYDzq67RGcw.text: AMAZING!! We stayed at the Kimpton and then had our 20TH anniversary dinner. I can't say enough about the quality of food and presentation....caprese salad was spot on....burrata cheese! We loved it so much we came back for brunch in the morning. Brandy was our hostess both times and she was so friendly and did everything she could to make our celebration special!! And Brittany was our server - - and she rocked! Gave us the perfect recommendation....shrimp/grits, bomboloni and eggs benedettina. Thanks so much for the incredible weekend and we'll be back!

sVvHUT2Z83ldmJU80jOeBg.text: Never got a chance to experience the food because of their poor reservation system. Apparently hostess are not able to make reservations for parties of more than 6. I called on Tuesday hoping to make a reservation for that Friday night. The hostess took down my information and said the appropriate manager would call and confirm with me. As of 8:00 am on Friday morning, I never received a confirmation call. I followed up myself the previous Thursday night and the hostess was of no help. I called on my own again Friday morning at 7:30. The hostess said she could make my reservation for me (weird how the rules just changed) but I needed to push my time back. However 10 minutes later she called and said my reservation would be canceled.   Now it's my birthday weekend, and I'm stuck finding somewhere who can hold a large party the day of!

UDtKTBc-BG1NaCgWdEmehg.text: OMG this might have been the greatest foodie experience of my life! We sat at the bar and our masterful bartender Marshall whipped up amazing original drinks left and right based on people's tastes and preferences! If you like rose wine, ask for one on crushed ice with port! If you like gin, ask for a muddled cucumber gimlet or a modified "power of love" egg white special with gin instead of bourbon. For food... I had a split half and half order of the pumpkin angnolotti and the capesante seared scallops. It came with two of each, large in size, big enough to share with my husband and it was the greatest!!! The freshness of the oil and the pasta was unequaled. Greatest meal I've had in ages! I will be back again and again! Thank you and grazzia!

Kx9HGqhEgJ0Ik-L6_R6iCg.text: Was able to check this place out last week when I was here for their soft opening.  The lighting is dim and the atmosphere comes off as intimate.  This place would be awesome for a date night or a small group happy hour.  I didn't have a chance to try the food but it all looked delicious so I'll definitely be coming back soon. As soon as you walk in you'll see a HUGE wine collection, so if you're a wine snob like myself...you'll fall in love with this place!  Service was fairly slow but I'll chalk that up to them being new.  I look forward to coming back.

poZ2fYW6Q3SeJ4qCQibqyQ.text: I had been looking forward towards this place coming from Raleigh. We enjoyed our expensive bottle of wine which was suggested by my boyfriend and not the waiter. The soup special was delicious and we were excited for what was to follow. We revived a salty bread with olive tapenade and then got our carbonara pizza that was beyond salty. Don't get me wrong I love salt but this was so overly salty and oily we had to wipe off the cheese and take off all the ingredients. As for the lamb pasta which we thought would change our perspective of the salty food, we were dead wrong. It tasted like Prego sauce and the lamb was not to be found. I was so disappointed and decided to not write a bad review until I got so sick that night and the following day. My boyfriend has had the worst gas and I the worst stomach pains. We woke up with a bloated face and fingers from the sodium. Maybe we had a bad batch but for the one special date night we had in Charlotte this was such a let down.

nhynRGFNQkKf-VJ3mXfMdw.text: They are now open for lunch which is perfect for our lunch outings.... the ricotta app is a must! It even holds well if you can't finish to eat for later. The environment is fresh and relaxing. Service was great .... minus the wait for a host to seat us. It's an awkward way to enter with no one actually at the door. The mussels are another must. I was enjoying everything so I forgot pictures.

mbeZBGCTW3erQ9kQuTE8GA.text: I really wanted to like this place, I tried very hard but the optimism was drawn out of me quickly. First of all I decided to take my wife here for her birthday, I called to ask if they offered valet parking and the hostess said they did... They do NOT offer valet parking but there is a parking deck across the street and they validate parking. The drinks are as described and not bad, the interior decor is nice as well... The food was disappointing to say the least... pretty sure I'll be sick tomorrow from the mussels. I had the squid ink pasta with mussels, scallops and what seemed like bacon chunks? It was horrible, some mussels were undercooked and some were extremely dry and overcooked (not sure how that happens). My wife ordered the ravioli which was described as cheesy and fruity (saving you from the long False explanation we recieved) hers tasted fishy, almost like it was cooked alongside a lobster and scallops.  If we ever come back I may try the pizza, but save yourself the loss of money and head straight upstairs to Merchant and Trade, they have food that looks way better and the views are amazing. The drinks are way better also upstairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States

6s3hOKSbjrKv9lCq_ypbLQ.text: Very quality food! We got the daily pizza, cecio de Pepe, eggplant and cioppono. Everyone enjoyed their meals and finished it all. We got the cheesecake for dessert to share and it came out beautifully and delicious. The host was really nice and fun. Giving us all superhero names. Our server was kind, attentive and knowledgeable. Meals came out fast! Would definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States

mWNeYswBMMKTz2yEREwfTQ.text: Great location downtown with ample parking spots nearby. Excellent blend of upscale contemporary meets neo-farmhouse. Nice drink menu, nothing over-elaborate but elegant and unique enough to entice one to order. We tried the margherita pizza, the gnocchi, the pit roasted chicken and the eggplant Parmesan. All great tasting and portions are actually just right. Good light music in the background makes this a great place for conversations and cool dining experience. The place does have a slightly dressy vibe, which is logical given the neighborhood and their decor. So don't expect to loiter in with shorts, however this is not a blazer mandatory place either.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gnocchi
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States

Xf7XV-3HoolwY_-fcTn_qA.text: We decided to dine here after attending a show on a Friday night. This was probably my first big disappointment here in CLT. The have an entrance through the hotel and they also have their own entrance(which they weren't using at this time due to it being a really cold night). Upon entering, the ambiance and decor is really good. The place looks great so kudos in that area.   They were fairly busy when we went, but were able to be seated quickly which was nice. The waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and gave a few recommendations. We ordered a Bellini, Pork Shank and the Ox Tail pasta. Unfortunately, both of these dishes were pretty flavorless. Not only were they bland, but the portion sizes were tiny. I do not typically mind smaller portion sizes as long as those bites are really well done, but that just was not the case here. The total was around $80, which is also fine for a fine dining establishment, but this felt like a complete waste of money. Maybe it was just an off night, but currently I could only suggest visiting here for the ambiance and maybe to grab a few drinks.

5VeuxW8fBflBvtUr2UxTjg.text: I really like Angeline's for an intimate date night. The service has consistently been a bit slow, even when they aren't packed. However the food and drinks are always well worth the wait!

osc1YPLNlL0JF-Y_z2JLvA.text: An average rating based on my two visits here in the last couple weeks. We came here for dinner one evening, and thought the service was wonderful, the drinks were good, and the food was average. so we returned with some friends, and this time sat at the bar. We ordered some drinks and pizzas. the drinks were drinkable, and the pizzas had us questioning how one could screw up a pizza? To top it, the below average service from the bartenders had me convinced that that would be my last visit to the restaurant. if you find yourself there, I hope it's on a good food and good service kinda day. As for me, i'm going to have to redeem myself by choosing a better Saturday night venue next time!

RQp9mgzyBrpd2q_73aokww.text: Service was lackluster and my poached eggs were VERY over cooked. The manager brought out delicious sunny side up eggs post-haste, which was good. My husband's French toast was good.   The bar the night before was friendly enough with good service. I'd probably get drinks again or maybe a bite at the bar, but I'd skip sitting down at a table for a meal.

okRtGDBqYonSAGq7EnoN7w.text: Second time and still fabulous. Pizzas and appetizers are seriously incredible. Matt S our server was excellent as the hostess is the most pleasant that it adds to the entire experience. And oh yeah the food. Can't say enuf

7WSDVwXXL82WdJHRkAgQDg.text: I don't know why this place gets such great reviews. Ambience is nice but food is mediocre at best.

gAKvky_MFB0h-2CXtHv-Kw.text: I wish I could give it more stars! I will start off by saying, the service is amazing. The manager was very attentive, extremely polite and in the end attempted to make things right. The restaurant itself is beautiful, its large and the sound proofing is top notch that being the case. There was not a seat available, everyone was talking and eating but I could clearly hear my friend at the table. All this said but this is a high-end restaurant, where one goes to dine and anticipates good food, not just good service, and aesthetics but the combo of all.   I hate to say it, the food is not that good! I ordered the BRAISED OXTAIL LUMACONI, while I love oxtail, this dish was a big miss. For starters, the entire dish was cold, yes cold, the oaxtail itself was at normal temperature, the pasta was either cold or slightly warm, super strange. The portions are small, and I get it when you have higher-end restaurants providing high quality items, that is not the entire complaint here. My wine which was the red zin, which was also cold... as if it was refrigerated. We made mention of all of this to the manager when he came and asked how we were doing, and he was very apologetic and offered to pay for our meal the next time we returned. I am not in a rush to return so I had asked that he hep me get access to the rooftop bar which is a ton of fun! A must actually.

cvTuWOZkyp82jE9IG191Ow.text: Came in from out of town on a rainy Sunday night and felt at home immediately.  The staff was warm, attentive and made great recommendations.  I had the whipped ricotta appetizer which is this wonderful salty sweet concoction that is great on the crusty bread or straight.  For my main I had the Braised Lamb Sugo Rigati.  It was good but I found myself wanting more lamb flavor throughout the dish.  I noshed on the delightful focaccia and olive tapenade so I didn't have room for desert but will save room for next time as they all looked wonderful.  I will be back!

8FGbhB1b52Q9w61o5zRbKA.text: My husband took me to dinner here for my birthday! For a restaurant that opened on November 1st, they were very crowded. However, since we had a reservation we did not have to wait.  Our server was very knowledgeable & attentive. We had the Whipped Ricotta as an appetizer. It was flavorful &  light without being filling. I had the Bistecca which is the 21 day aged ribeye. It was well seasoned & very tender.  The ambience was very upscale & modern. However, a little too noisy to be deemed romantic. I would definitely characterize this as a special occasion restaurant or one to take friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States

wFa6_mIrHuuWAF3YwizJKA.text: The ambiance and service here was great, however, the food wasn't as good as we expected for the price. We came with a big group (about 9) and had reservations, so we had a great table and very nice waitress. We ordered the calamari and ricotta cheese for appetizers, which were the highlight of the meal. Several of us got pizzas, but the favorite by far was the half chicken or the pasta with bolognese. We didn't sit outside, but if you're going, id recommend sitting outside and getting just drinks and appetizers.

LiU3sj_Xo8UfiusgmSUopg.text: Very good business lunch spot uptown. High level of service is evident from when you arrive. Two of us had flatbreads and one a salad. Quality dishes and not overly heavy flatbreads. Service was attentive but were good at not interrupting the business conversation. Recommend for entertaining clients.

p1uDe4ZNBTy1i1D1a_864w.text: The reason they are getting one star is because I will not go and eat there because you have to pay $18 to valet park. There are dozens of restaurants in the Uptown area and all of them offer complimentary valet parking. Charging $18 to come eat at your restaurant is absurd you guys are going to lose a lot of business over this.

RvSnJAMoJciYjeszxvL3jw.text: Visiting Charlotte from NYC and decided to check  out Angeline's with my sister. We had dinner reservations at 8:45 last night (Saturday) and once we entered we were greeted politely by the hostess however our table wasn't ready so we went to grab a drink at the bar.   Bar  After waiting 5 mins to be acknowledged by the bartender (the bar was full but not overly busy, just people waiting for their reserved tables) I asked the bartender about their cocktails and what he would recommend, he had NO opinion and said the menu was new. I was slightly taken back that the bartender had no opinion nor suggestion on any bar drinks on their menu. I am paying New York and LA prices for a drink and you aren't selling it to me. ($16 for a drink) Luckily I ordered something based on my preference of alcohol and it ended up being great. The experience at the bar was very disappointing, hopefully they will staff another bartender on Friday and Saturday nights as the two there seemed to be very overwhelmed, which reflected their ability to provide great customer service.   We were sat around 9:15 -- The restaurant was barely 2/3 of the way full and waited 30mins to be seated after our reservation time.   Dinner Our dinner was good, the food came out very quickly we ordered the Bolognese and the Chop Salad. I would suggest both! My sister wasn't overly impressed by dinner but I thought it was good. The service at the table was great, he was very friendly however the waiter didn't greet our table for 4 minutes, which in this situation is a very long time. We ordered Bar drinks right away and received  them a few minutes before our food arrived, again the bar was struggling to get drinks out.   More than likely I will never visit Angeline's again, the customer service is lacking and the food isn't making up for it. This restaurant has a lot of potential however they need to work out the kinks..

gCDunyFHOF3iesCr4Ue7og.text: Issa no for me, dawg.  This restaurant is located in an hotel. They have their own private entrance, but we entered through the hotel entrance.  The place was packed, but my party of two was seated fairly quickly.  Our waitress was great! She gave a lot of suggestions and it was hard for me to choose my order.   I decided on the oxtail pasta, because why not? Y'all I was so excited for this pasta! Oxtails + carbs is a guaranteed winner. Right?! Nope. I'm really sensitive to salt and this meal was so bland. NO FLAVOR WHATSOEVER. My taste buds were so confused.  If I come back to this place, it will be for drinks only.

KH3KbBYgPNIfVaoFVkACTw.text: We finally came to dinner at Angeline's. we really liked both dishes that we ordered  -oxtail pasta - yum yum! The oxtail was seasoned very well and had a distinct flavor. The pasta was a wee bit over cooked. But overall good  -branzino - excellent. You could really taste the wood smoked flavor.  -Brussels sprouts - nice and glazed.   -coffee was a nice night cap.   Overall 4 stars

9aiXS_-HoWbBJvU5dJ2gUg.text: Me and my fiance went to Angeline's last night for the first time. We have birthdays within 4 days of each other so we always try a new restaurant to celebrate both our birthdays, this year - we chose Angeline's because neither of us had ever been. I honestly can't say enough good things about this restaurant. We got a drink at the bar while we were waiting on our table to be cleaned and the bartender was so nice and tentative. When our table was ready, very quickly might I add, we were escorted by the kindest hostess I've ever dealt with, and she handed me a rose and a handwritten happy birthday card. When I handed the card to my fiance, she realized it was also his birthday and then came back with another hand written card for him. The service was outstanding. We ordered the calamari appetizer and both ordered chicken Parmesan for dinner. (Boring, I know) But quite honestly, it was the best chicken Parmesan I've ever had. And my fiance is Italian! We were truly impressed. We then ordered the chocolate cake dessert to share, but the wait staff brought out TWO desserts (one strawberry cheesecake and also the chocolate cake we ordered) with happy birthday written on them and a candle in each. It was truly a wonderful experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Parmesan

OxuEu4eMS7tabwDGonPIPQ.text: DISAPPOINTED.  The drinks were fine.  The mozzarella nubs were ok  Had the Lamb and it was way too salty, like salt lick salty, and very spicy.   I took 2 bites and could not force a third.  Told the staff who just really didn't care.  Didn't ask if I wanted anything else just shrugged their shoulders.  One and done.... Won't be back

PgYJb5s8K0pEybkNFdFxTw.text: The menu is limited but it's of great quality. The grilled chicken was moist and tender. The portions can serve two. Good atmosphere and bar had great selection.

Q3WxXUyo-vbwVyM3flyc5A.text: Wow Did not expect a great meal but this was terrible, especially for $60+ for just me. First off, a $21 SMALL pour if barolo that tasted like a $10 bottle Next a chopped salad with more dressing than nutrients. And basically cheap veggies such as cucumber and cherry tomatoes. Not edible with so much dressing Last the waiter recommended cacio de pepe Overcooked pasta, melted cheese and so much black pepper! Butchered a simple dish royally. Yuck And a rip off

TUFIwQ5NQy4cUXr3S0Rceg.text: Wow!  What an amazing night.  We arrived on a Saturday night with no reservation.  A group of four, highly motivated, young guys looking for drinks and things.... and we were seated at a table of our choice within 5 minutes.  The outside patio area is fantastic.  They added a wood grain detail to the poured concrete retaining wall that blocks the city bustle from the dining experience.  Music plays from green outdoor speakers which kind of look like giant ant bait traps, but the sound quality and selection are perfect.  We were able to talk and enjoy the music without yelling over it.    The food was so tasty.  I had a salad and some pasta, and both were a tad on the small side, but highly flavorful.  I asked the hostess about my salad not having blue cheese crumbles on it as advertised, and she quickly made it right. I wasn't looking for a redo or a refund, but she made sure I left happy.  The pasta was SOOO GOOOD!!! I could have eaten three of the dishes full of  the al dente tagliatelle!!   Oh, how can I forget the drink?!  I had what was in essence a margarita, but a variation that was even better.  I believe it was called Cold Storage, YUM!!    The service was prompt and continuous.  Floors and tables were kept very clean, and the decorations were extremely tasteful and modern.  It was a great experience and I will certainly be back!!  Oh, the hostess gave me a flower when I was leaving because she said I made her night.  How sweet?!

5INMnefJyeqWGzmtSSR8Gg.text: Oh. My. Brunch. I LOVE a good brunch with a good deal on mimosas. They have a 1.5L champagne bottle with juice available (hint you can pour your own champagne & juice for the perfect ratio). The food was very tasty and they had a decent variety for brunch.

EwHMjLV2-6rqMQ4pvuC0Ug.text: The food was just ok. Definitely not traditional Italian cuisine. Wish they had more traditional Italian food on their menu. Not worth going if you want traditional Italian cuisine. More of an Americanized European style.

HRvEY4u3L1d6IxFPfDVVVA.text: Absolutely incredible food. Came here and immediately felt at home from the time the hostess sat me until I left. The food is amazing! I mean what a culinary experience!!! Incredible!

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fritto Misto

Gh2ZCJKRRhuNYdu8L_-Wwg.text: Rarely do I book a table at a restaurant without checking the Yelp reviews, but this time, I'm happy I didn't. I dined at Angeline's on the night of my 21st birthday about a week ago. I can only attribute the low star ratings to growing pains, as the restaurant is fairly new. I can attest that they have worked out the kinks.  First off, I booked a reservation for 2 on OpenTable and noted that I was celebrating a birthday. We arrived and were greeted by the hosts, who were very sweet. When we sat down, there was a handwritten note on the table that said thank you for choosing us on our special day. Nice, but not enough to warrant a 5-star review. What really made our night was our server, Taylor. The service was flawless - she was knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive. I was downright impressed, as I used to wait tables, and I know she's got this down to a science. Let me also note that the restaurant is gorgeous inside and the ambiance is lovely, not too quiet nor loud.  Now that I've bored you with the details, let's discuss food. WOW. Just wow. We started with calamari and risotto. Both blew me away. The calamari was fresh, flavorful, and cooked perfectly. The fried lemon served in the dish was a bold move that was executed well. The risotto was some of the best I've ever had, albeit untraditional. My boyfriend and I were having trouble deciding between two pasta dishes, so our server suggested we get half-portions of both for the same price as one full dish. We were sold and each got half-portions (if you're thinking "why didn't you each get one of the dishes?" it's because we don't like to share.) Moving on, the pasta was great, and obviously freshly made. We shared a bottle of Italian Moscato; a bit pricey but worth every penny.   I would absolutely recommend a dinner at Angeline's, despite the low reviews from earlier. My experience was nothing but positive. Lovely atmosphere, drink selection, and menu. Absolutely worth a visit.

OpkC4zu3h4sTVYRPrUOu3g.text: Came in after 10pm on a Friday night. My SO and I had just checked in to the Kimpton hotel and wanted to grab a bite to eat without going too far from the hotel. The hotel staff members directed us where to enter. When we walked in, it wasn't clear to us where we were supposed to go. It looked like a nice enough restaurant where you wait to be seated, so we decided to stand near the other entrance.  After standing there, confused for a few minutes, a friendly face finally greeted us. We told the hostess we heard from the hotel that they close at 11 and asked if they still have full service. She informed us that they only serve pizza between 10pm-11pm. We were fine with that then we asked to sit at the bar.  The restaurant staff quickly cleaned off and prepared our section. The three bartenders (2 males and 1 female) took very good care of us. They were very friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. My SO asked for a drink with whiskey, something similar to an old fashioned. The bartender suggested a boulevardier ($11+), composed of whiskey, vermouth, and campari. My SO decided to try that. I ordered the rossini ($11), which is prosecco with strawberry. The SO really enjoyed his cocktail, so much so that he tried to order it again at another bar. My rossini was refreshing as expected.  I ordered the carbonara pizza ($16) and the SO the confit potato ($16). Both pizzas came out as described. However, both were too salty for my liking. I love pizza and usually don't mind the saltiness of it, but this was almost overwhelming. Even the egg on my pizza was too salty! It was late and I was hungry after traveling, so I slowly but surely worked my way to finishing my personal pizza. The salt level didn't seem to bother my SO. He actually enjoyed his pizza.   The place is new, just opened on November 1st. It's clean and beautifully and carefully decorated. I am curious enough to come back and try other items on their menu. I do not think I will be ordering any of their pizzas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carbonara - very salty
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Confit Potato - very salty
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rossini

rRqVvA3jbd1i9vkNyEUfFQ.text: THE RESTAURANT: New age Italian style restaurant attached to the Kimpton Tyron Park Hotel (don't be like me and wander outside for 10 minutes). The restaurant has dark, pleasant ambiance with an open kitchen concept and a full stacked bar. Layout is friendly for groups up to 6 with a larger room in the back. Adequate selection of wine but slightly limited for orders by glass. Menu is relatively. The staff could be a little more attentive in terms of checking up on tables (7:30 on a Monday was @ ~60% capacity).   THE FOOD: Wine was delicious, bread was delicious. Ordered the Porchetta which came in a pool of Polenta and oil. First and second bites were delicious, but from there on our it became nauseatingly heavy and oily. The pasta looked great though so would probably try that next time.  THE STAFF/SERVICE Interactions with the staff can be quite different, table next to mine was high energy, engaging, and in depth with explanations of the menu, bar, and restaurant where mine was a bit more hands off (I did eat by myself).  Though my waitress never asked how the meal was, offered to switch out my entree after I brought up the heaviness of the meal. After declining twice, she comped the entree with no hesitation. Finishing off the glass of Malbec now, which is doing a surprisingly good job of balancing out the pork belly.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Porchetta

bhhKil1L_qgdqel59DqTXA.text: Very disappointing! We are Italians and therefore we can say that the food in this restaurant had nothing to do with traditional Italian food.  The menu was very small which would be ok if the offered dishes would have been fresh and delicious. But that was not the case. The catch of the day was totally bland. The side, wild brokkoli, was cold and hard. Also the seafood pasta was tasteless and overcooked. The seafood in the pasta were two scallops and some clams, that's it. The food was totally overpriced, the plates were small and carelessly done.  We didn't complain because the young waiter did a good job and we didn't want him to feel uncomfortable. The service people who brought the check disappeared abruptly without asking if everything was ok. Sorry, but this was one of the worst restaurant experiences since we have been living here.

w2CZF4SIOv09G9Rkn7D4Fg.text: Awesome atmosphere. Industrial meets posh NYC. Located inside a hotel, but not a classic hotel restaurant. Service was 4 star, not 5 - but they are new, so give that some time.  Best on the menu: WOOD FIRE ROASTED BRANZINO, a whole fish cooked with head and tail on, served as such, with Roasted Red Pepper Coulis, Tapenade, Roasted Cauliflower, Salmon Roe  AMAZING!!!!  For an app, i really loved the BRANZINO CRUDO, Grapefruit, Fregola, Cold Pressed Olive Oil - Very refreshing and not heavy.  Other contenders for main courses:  PUMPKIN AGNOLOTTI Ricotta, Spiced Pepitas, Collards, Hen of the Woods  CAPESANTE Pan Seared Scallops, Braised Mustard Greens, Smoked Ham Hock Jus, Prosciutto Chip  Drinks to try!  POWER OF LOVE Bourbon, Ginger, Rosso Vermouth, Lemon, Egg White  A LONG PLACE IN THE SUN (My fave!) Cynar, Madeira, Lemon, Rosemary  THE GODFATHER'S GODSON Laphroaig 10yr, Amaretto, Fernet Branca, Kahlua

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. CAPESANTE, Pan Seared Scallops
Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. WOOD FIRE ROASTED BRANZINO, POWER OF LOVE, A LONG PLACE IN THE SUN

IhB2vV3vCgdMEEOpEoUtMw.text: This past weekend I was supposed to be out of town but couldn't go due to the rain/sleet/snow mess we had just gotten.  My husband and I decided to go to a bunch of our favorite spots and a new one for dinner. Angeline's was that spot. It was perfectly lit (lighting makes it or breaks it for me), warm and welcoming and a nice manageable size.  Our waiter was on it and timed things just right. I have to say, I didn't really explore the menu since I saw cacio e pepe pasta right away. I looked no further! That's what I wanted. The waiter did put a disclaimer out to let me know that all it was was pasta without any meat or vegetables. I already knew that because of what I had ordered but apparently others who have ordered didn't know what they were getting. My guy got bolognese. Everything was really great. It's a good date spot but there was a larger family next to me and a large group of friends was also there.  Tip: If you are here around Christmas time you can walk around the corner and go to the Christmas market too.

yPFaqxjoctVQQkjg94KzVg.text: Loved this spot. The bartenders were awesome and made delicious drinks. The peach persuasion and the power of love were my favorites. Good spot to go for a few cocktails

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. The power of love, sub tequila

c-AUbC6e04GO8ybch8-ggg.text: I took the Mrs. out on a date here. I ordered a whiskey and the bartender asked if I wanted a single large ice cube. At that point I knew I was in for something special. The Mrs. got a cocktail made with fresh blueberries and cinnamon. It tasted well crafted and refreshing. She had the Bolognese and allowed me to try it and it was hearty and delicious. I was intrigued by the daily special, a white sauce pizza with pickled peppers, tomatoes, and small onions so I ordered and was not disappointed.

LJUQ44OBwokyy4TYjinKdQ.text: Oh I have been looking forward to this experience for months and what a let-down it was. It was my birthday. First, we were seated next to the door - most certainly the most unromantic table available as the bar was busy and there were many people standing around us. Then the server talked down to us, saying, 'Let's go over the words you don't know.' WHAT?  The food was less than mediocre. My husband's dish was something you could get anywhere. My pappardelle bolognese was way overseasoned with nutmeg or cinnamon. It was the only flavor I could taste. We went 10 minutes with empty wine glasses. I think this is in opposition to one of the ten commandments, no?  The check was dropped without asking if we wanted dessert and it was my birthday! This is where I lost it on the server a little bit.  And, lastly, I am not saying that this is a food-borne illness thing, but after about 4 hours of eating that terrible bolognese, it all came back up. I got so sick for about 12 hours. And it wasn't the alcohol as I only had 1.5 glasses of wine.  Never again, Angeline's!  And PS - What a terrible place for a hostess stand. It needs to be moved!

QCtpF-4mgr6hnrD1k6qC8Q.text: Came a bit early for a panthers game and decided to try this bistro for brunch.  It's a really neat spot.  The avocado toast and meatball sandwich were sublime.  The hot tea is legit.  The service/bar staff were top notch.  If you're in the stadium area, check it out!

6HseOrlO1ND1KqGWZuEc7w.text: Stopped on a business trip despite some poor reviews. Very nice greeter and bartender was great. Had calamari & margarita pizza, basic but tasty. Good service nice atmosphere.

cAPJCOe0qVucos_VNwo-EQ.text: Well.   2 stars for the friendly welcome and 1 for the appetizer. So 1 and 2 not really 3.   Nice space. Friendly staff.  Limited menu which normally relates to being excellent food.   Not.   Ricotta appetizer great.  Very very good.   Calamari a slight step above fast food ok. But just ok.  Cod main.  Over cooked and tasteless.   Pasta with Speck and Ricotta so tasteless ..  needed to heap on salt and pepper.  Still only ate a 3rd.    Such a shame as was promising at first.    Oh well.   SC.

ynXBSKEasUmQZPrgwu15OA.text: Had a great meal at Angelines! Everything from the food to the service to the atmosphere was perfect! The atmosphere is warm and they really paid attention to all of the details on the design.   Wine list is great, containing wines from all over the world and at all price points. Had a delicious Barbera, as well as some great cocktails!   Food was excellent, my favorites were the fried calamari, braised oxtail lumaconi and the brussel sprouts. The homemade pasta and sauce was incredible. Very rich dish so perfect for sharing! Ended the meal with the zeppoli, which are little Italian doughnuts. They were phenomenal and I especially loved the buttermilk ice cream they were served with. We also tried the carbonara pizza and the Queen's Chop Salad.   Casey was an excellent server. Took great care of us and was very friendly. The manager came over a couple of times as well and we enjoyed chatting with her.   Can't wait to go back for dinner again as well as try their brunch!

kkQOjdeXOhJbo68QQWNgAQ.text: First of all: hahahahahahahhahahahahahahahahahahahaha.............omg. Can you believe this place?!!!! This is an embarrassment to Italian food. I had a chopped salad. I swear it was all of 2 leaves of Romain with some pine nuts. ($12) I asked for the "power of love" cocktail minus egg white. The bartender was confused and said they could not make it without egg whites. ...... she eventually realized how absurd that sounded and then she served it in a tiny glass to get back at me..........what??!!! Really??!! I can't stop laughing......How are all these people at the bar so overweight?????? The appetizer portions are microscopic!!!!  We had one cocktail, one beer, one TINY chopped salad and the mussels. Bill was $45. What?!!!!??? I'm going to stop at Wendy's on my way home. This is stupid....I'm still soooo hungry....i mean hangry.   The drink without the egg white and the arrabiata sauce were good.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two leaf salad!!!!!!  ridiculous....

PPOr9BNew3LqvnoRZa074w.text: Great vibes here! And perfect for date night :)   We had the mussels, which were absolutely great! The server even brought us extra bread for the leftover sauce.   The disappointing part was that a lot of the mussel shells were empty, so we felt like we didn't get a very good portion size.   We did have the kale lasagna dish (forgetting the name here) but it was fabulous! the chef even had it split for us to make things easier. Drinks were also great.. I had the one w/ the rose (again forgetting the name) and my date had the Basic Bee which was super tasty!

77e63omVCQToq-sYOg4c_A.text: If you're looking for good Italian, you've got to stop here.   My boyfriend and I decided to have our date night here and was blown away. We had:  - Polpette: pork and lamb meatballs that we were basically fighting for who will get the last piece.  They were that good.   - Whipped Ricotta: a classic. There's lavender honey that gives the ricotta a subtle sweetness. You may find yourself taking your last bread and scraping as much off the plate as possible. Haha - Tettrazini: this was a hit. Take one bite and you can instantly taste how fresh the pasta is (and I'm all about some homemade pasta). With the shredded chicken, peas and mushrooms, this dish satisfied all my taste buds.  - Ribeye: my boyfriend got the ribeye, which isn't your plain steak and potatoes dish. It's massive! It's so big that it has it's own plate (which he was very happy about).  - Geechie Boy Polenta: this was a nice little side dish that had no chance. I found my boyfriend basically scraping every corner to make sure it was all gone. But eat it while its warm; polenta isn't that great once it gets cold.  Last but not least, the service was amazing! Dylan was our server who gave great descriptions of each dish (he's the one who sold me on the Tettrazini - thank you!) and had great conversation with us.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tettrazini

dvHJ9ThgPXakVL6Zlvgkzw.text: Fantastic service and great food. We ordered one glass of wine since we had other plans after dinner. The waiter caught an off the cuff remark that we would just share the glass of wine and went out of his way to bring us a second empty glass so we could split it.  It seemed everyone on the patio got the Whipped Ricotta, which lived up to expectations. If it's your first time visiting Angeline's (and you eat dairy), it's a must have. Again the waiter was fantastic and brought us extra bread when he realized we were trying to put the remaining half of the ricotta on our last piece.  We ordered the Pappardelle and Eggplant Parmesan. The Pappardelle was fantastic (possibly one of the best Italian dishes I have had without needing to leave the country). The Eggplant Parmesan was also amazing and certainly left me wanting more. Highly recommend this place!

mD7_DZMXfJhXYd9ouDvIlw.text: We had eaten here before and it was pretty good, but we went last weekend and sat on the porch and enjoyed a wonderful meal!  We were seated after 20 minutes outside with no reservation at 7:30 on a Saturday, and enjoyed the mussels and Brussels to start with our cocktails. The mussels were so tasty!! Some of the best I've had in Charlotte.  For our meal, we both got pizzas and split a bottle of Italian red. All delicious! Our waiter was engaging, provided good recommendations and was perfectly attentive. It also was quite pleasant on the patio, even on a chillier spring evening, as it's shielded from the breeze.  So happy to have this quiet outdoor spot in uptown! We'll definitely be back

QG3D3EaVdKhz2sDYznlK2g.text: Nice Italian restaurant in downtown Charlotte. We were able to move around large party reservations easily and it didn't seem too crowded on a Thursday evening. Our server was super nice and friendly.   To share, we ordered the meat and cheese platter, bread with ricotta cheese spread, arancini, calamari, and focaccia. I really liked the focaccia with olive tapenade and the ricotta cheese!   We got a few pizzas to share and I enjoyed the truffle and our modified margherita (with mushrooms and chili peppers). It was a good amount of spice. The crust was more on the thin and crispy side, less on the bubbly and fluffy side.   Lastly, I recommend the chocolate cake for dessert!

0wxj3GyaYI9u7xvcb7g2Iw.text: Sad to say - I want to like this place but after 2 visits (one with my family & one with a big group of 10), this place fails to impress. First, the hostess is great - she set a tone that we had high expectations ... big personality and laughs before we even started the dining journey. The actual menu was exciting - again, high hopes. I'd say the charcuterie and ricotta apps were our favorites. The meals - EH. Not good. I ordered the eggplant parm and it tasted like a "loaf" of baked breading. Where was the eggplant? Seriously - the eggplant and mozzarella were incognito. I couldn't finish. Others got the pasta dishes that looked tasty but were just OK. The seafood was a bit over cooked and the service was also just OK. For the pricing, I was truly hoping for more. I'd say stick with the other Italian places that will knock your socks off..... (Luce is nearby).

spRIo3StUs4OlLpDv4H5yQ.text: Brussel sprouts were cold. Service was horrible. Veal was amazing.

p0ymzNZsKQr6SDjDFe3eyA.text: Oh, Angeline's.. Where to begin about my experience here!  Let's start with my first check-in. I came here and did a walkthrough of the restaurant about a month and a half ago. Debating whether or not to host my private birthday dinner here with friends. I checked out several places as I do every year and narrow it down. However this year surprisingly I decided to have a dinner at all. Though the place was beautiful I wanted to do something a little different this year... I wanted to enjoy a nice dinner SOLO! Get dressed up, hair done, makeup done and just enjoy a night out!  Making Plans I had three restaurants in mind and the night of my birthday I still couldn't decide, so I hit up my friend Nikki - Yelp Charlotte Director for help lmbo! She made a VERY great point, she said, "I would suggest calling first to see who's available with the Belk event happening." She's so WISE! LOL! So I called my first place and they weren't available, then Angeline's and a nice young lady answered the phone. I asked her if they were accepting reservations or had availability for dinner that evening. I provided her my time and she said OH YES! You'll be fine! I'll put you down, will you be dining with someone... Me: Nope just me! My parents are saying they will join me because they don't want me to eat alone on my birthday so you can put possible two lol.   Arriving I parked about a block away on the street and walked to the restaurant. I noticed that Merchant and Trade had a little line. I've heard so much about the place I stopped to ask the door guy a few questions about it. Then decided in my head that I would go have a drink there after dinner. I walked into Angeline's and Jennifer greeted me, I said I was here for my 9:30 pm reservation. She said oh YES you're the Birthday Girl... Happy Birthday! I was smiling from EAR TO EAR as I thanked her. She even remembered and asked if my parents would be joining me, which I said no because I wanted to have dinner solo. She walked me to my table then raved over my handbag. We somehow started chatting as girls do than exchange Instagram handles. LOL! She really made me feel welcomed and then handed me a birthday card! What restaurant do you know gives their guest BIRTHDAY CARDS! So sweet!  Server My server came out and introduced himself, provided me with a drink menu and said he would return with some bread for me to start with. I ordered a glass of Prosecco and started with the Calamari. Yes, Champagne all night, ESPECIALLY on your birthday! He did not rush me at all, he even came over and engaged in casual conversation with me. We laughed as I shared my age, he couldn't believe it. As I was halfway through with my calamari he asked if I wanted anything else. I was debating because I didn't want anything too heavy because it was so late, and I didn't want to carry a bag upstairs to Merchant and Trade if I didn't finish it. I told him I was debating on the Queen City Salad but didn't know for sure. 10 minutes later the salad came out! I was like what! He said, Happy Birthday Lovely. How SWEET!  Food The food was so good, like REALLY good. I really enjoyed the bread and the oil spread they provided with it. I'm not sure of the correct name but it was really good. I also like the calamari, I like when calamari is served with the tinticles and rings. The Queen City salad was also delicious, tossed in the house dressing. So good!  Closing As I finished the delicious salad and was ready to pay for my meal, he brought out the check and said, I bought your glass of champagne for your birthday! Loved it! Totally unexpected but much appreciated. Celebrate every blessing big or small! I truly and thoroughly enjoyed myself and my experience at Angeline's.

R7MDfd_SK5f4jXZ5C2EM6A.text: This is a beautiful restaurant in a great hotel where we spent 2 nights. My son and I came for breakfast and we really liked our server. I believe her name was Donara and she was just lovely. The coffee was good and strong. I got steel cut oats and it was good but served room temperature. My son got chicken and biscuit and liked it ok. He didn't like the runny egg. We would return for the regular menu as it's a nice place.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from our table

-Mkr9aXhudzPl4lVbtITUw.text: I'm sorry did someone say there was a new Italian restaurant in uptown?  Well it's new to me.  It's attached to the Kimpton Tryon Park Hotel, also new to me.  Angeline's is pretty upscale, lovely decor, but for lunch I expect to be in and out in a hour, but this place was a little slow with getting the food out, and that shouldn't happen during lunch hours.    The pappardelle was great, and was fresh pasta but I really wish it had more sauce, which was a little disappointing.  My friend had the burger which he said was fresh but not seasoned well.  I also had a side of the polenta with mushrooms......not very flavorful but not too bad.  The portion size was perfect and the service ranged from very attentive initially to having to flag down someone......again this is not what I expect during lunch.  I'll consider returning for takeout I guess.

ql5G2gPg9zJcQDQ1GFoTag.text: Bread- fabulous!! Had a wonderful oil and balsamic vinaigrette. My friend liked the anchovie enpanad   Salads- Cesar-  Incredible!!! The Cesar dressing was like a cross between a mild Cesar and ranch. So good! Probably the best I've had and I've had a lot!!  Soup of The Day $9 - Spicy Tomato Bisque - Tad spicy but nice a flavor.   MAIN ENTREES.. Cacio E Pepe $13 - Tagliatelle, Chervil, Shaved Parmesan, Tellicherry Pepper - loved it! I decided against the chives and had parcley instead.   Red snapper- my friend said it wasn't a lot of food, but it was good.   SIDES.. Roasted Cauliflower $8 - Tapenade - Incredible flavor!  CAN'T WAIT TO TRY.. Margherita Pizza -Fresh Mozzarella, Torn Basil, Pecorino, Tomato Sauce

3790OYndwnVvwVOPDq9E0Q.text: We had a small birthday dinner here. We were greeted & seated quickly. The atmosphere is very nice, a little mature for our 5 year old, but we didn't feel out of place. Our waiter was excellent and checked on us often.  The focaccia bread and olive tapenade starter was tasty. We ordered a margherita pizza as our appetizer / kids meal. Not the best pizza ever, but good. The crust is thin, which worked in our favor by not being too filling.  We both ordered the pappardelle bolognese and we LOVED it. Nice size portion and the pasta was perfectly done.  We shared the pineapple cake with lemon sorbet. Perfect palette-cleansing finisher.  We really enjoyed our dinner and will be back to try brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pappardelle

VmB2CJc1yA7MJdyVtAXcXA.text: A nice addition to Uptown's bar and restaurant scene. Located inside the new Kimpton Tryon Park Hotel (you can enter from the street or inside through the hotel), the interior is beautifully done with the shining star being the bar. Solid cocktail, beer and wine list (variety of price points per bottle which is nice depending on your budget/ what you are looking for). The whipped ricotta served with toasted sourdough is a great appetizer as well as the Queen's Chop Salad and Ribbolita soup (think beans, kale and olive oil). I have not tried the pizza, but I have seen it come out a few times and it looks delicious. The split roasted half chicken entree was great and a very generous portion. I have had the tiramisu for dessert a few times now and it is always consistent and tasty. We tried the chocolate cake last night and it was very tasty.   Great date spot for dinner, then head up to the Kimpton's rooftop bar, Merchant and Trade, for cocktails and music!

K7CXCuw6IcPrC16lNauHeQ.text: This is a lovely and intimate restaurant.  It can seem a bit bustling at times, but never overwhelmingly so.  The food is prepared so well and is aromatic and delicious.  We've had several different things and have loved them all, so just try anything that captures your attention.  The open kitchen is interesting to see and you don't hear a lot of noise from it, which is a nice benefit...enjoy the show, but it doesn't take over the dining room.  Their ventilation system is working well!  I hope they keep that in check.  This restaurant is in the Kimpton Tryon Park and Merchant and Trade is also here.  This can be a great progressive evening out without leaving the building!  I definitely will be back and recommend it to you!

d8nh-XAM6yB_bHPc07eFWg.text: Our "Social Media Mavens" Dean's List Dinner at Angeline's was simply  a beautiful experience. From the food to the service to the atmosphere, we were blown away by the impact of the dinner of our attendees. We had the beautiful table right at the entrance with 12 women - each month we focus on a different topic.   Our topic focused on meaningful connections through social media, how to make negative experiences online turn into good ones, what it means to make a social IMPACT through social influence, and what specific time management/self-care tricks can keep you in the present. We were able to hear each other perfectly in our private dining experience and the food was absolutely delicious.

GvJrLKaxgJTs3CsB22SUHg.text: We had a reservation with a few friends on a Wednesday night for dinner. The food was decent but was well over shadowed by the lack of service! It was a struggle even when we were trying to receive and pay the check! The forgot our salad and when I brought it to the manager and the servers attention, the responded in a very calm voice : " They didn't bring those to you?" As we were trying to leave I asked for parking validation which was done! However upon exit the parking ticket didn't work and after several attempts we paid the high parking price and left! Needless to say that I don't recommend this place and won't return! There are several options available within walking distance!

IvGv50AyoURps9fyehbuHw.text: Thus far I've visited twice and food is pretty good. I enjoyed the meatballs/polpette, sausage pizza, ribeye and pappardelle.  The ambiance and service is wonderful.  Pretty much a nice dinner uptown in a central location to meet friends or date night and easy to transition upstairs to Merchant and Trade for cocktails and view of the city.

photos.caption: Photo of Angeline's - Charlotte, NC, United States. Papparedelle

9WDDLak32WS9ZgHONWbK3Q.text: I had dinner at Angeline's with friends on a Friday evening around 9 pm. We sat outside on their beautiful patio which was expertly decorated and dimly lit - the ambiance was great.   We asked what the waiter recommended and we then ordered several items to share based on those recommendations; the items were brought out at different times. The first item we were delivered was the calamari which I'd give a 2 - it lacked flavor and all you really tasted was the fried taste. Then came the melon and prosciutto which I'd give a 2 - for over $10 there was nothing to this dish, literally just 5 slices of prosciutto and a few chunks of melon. Next up were the Brussel sprouts which I'd give a 2 - these had 0 flavor and really it was just the shavings of Brussels sprouts rather than the actual sprouts themselves. We had a mashed potato pizza with sausage which I'd give a 2 - kind of a weird combo and certainly not worth $16.  Then we had the mussels which I'd give a 4- they were huge, full of labor, and awesome to share. Only downside is they were served without bread, and after we finished the mussels there was tons of broth in the bowl we wanted to try so we asked for a couple slices of bread which they later charged us $4 for. We also had the oxtail pasta which I'd give a 4 - it was flavorful and delicious, but there was not nearly enough meat to justify the $26 price tag.  Overall the ambiance was great, service was fine, food was really subpar. For a meal over $100 I would expect much more, especially when we ordered what the waiter recommended as the best items on the menu.

_7_AjAC6QRlfbwIY298K0g.text: This place has the potential of being a True gem in Charlotte Uptown Crown! I went for lunch and was in the mood for seafood and they definitely delivered! I saw at the bar and I'm sorry if don't remember the bartenders name but they were awesome! We talked as is if we known each other for years. I ordered he fried calamari and mussels. The fried calamari was perfectly fried and seasoned to perfection they serve it with a mayonnaise based sauce That was delicious. The mussels were prepared in a tomato based sauce that had just enough kick too it and came with 2 pieces of toasted bread which went great with sauce.  They have a great outdoor seating if the weather permits.  Can't wait to go back and try the lamb meal!

LyvLc2BY45VaclfWNY46Jw.text: Best place that I've eaten in Charlotte so far! Hands down the best service and best tasting food. The flavor profile was very complex. Some examples of this would be combinations of pistachio, honey, and lavender for the whipped ricotta. The mussels for the appetizer the aged steak for the main was also phenomenal in terms of its taste and flavor profile. The atmosphere was also very calming and the decor was super cute. I went with my co-workers but this would also be a very good date night! I would definitely go back again and l highly recommend that you try it out!

phVXVBEtjAkGlcdXJuARcQ.text: Great alternative when the line for merchant and trade is too long. We stopped in to have some drinks here instead. The drinks are nothing memorable, but what was memorable was the attitude of the bar tenders. I understand you're a brand new restaurant in the new hotel in town, but, remember the town is Charlotte NC, not NYC. We sampled two of the pizzas also, again disappointing, the potato pizza lacked any real flavor, and both pizzas just left a bitter aftertaste in our mouths from the charred bits of crap stuck to the bottom of the crusts. I think next time, just stick to waiting in line to go upstairs.

wrXDSf_tY1kf_AykUHkfYw.text: Decided to try Angeline's for new years even though I've heard some mixed reviews. My overall opinion on the restaurant was okay. The restaurant looked nice and the service was great. They had they're prefixed new years menu which had some good options. The appetizers were good but the main course we both ordered the ribeye medium rare and when we got it the dish was cold and both ribeyes were pretty rare which I don't mind but I would like what I ordered for a restaurant this nice. The veggies on the plate were also cold which made the dish all together disappointing. The flavor was good and I'm sure if I asked they would have made us a new dish but seemed like too much trouble. The dessert dishes were decent, the chocolate cake was okay just a little too bitter and the mousse I ordered was pretty good. The cocktails were really good also. I would give them another try with the regular menu to compare but maybe wait a while before I go back since they are fairly new.
